definitions.explanation_en: A liquid intended for consumption, especially to quench thirst or for pleasure, including water, juice, alcohol, or other beverages.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指用于饮用以解渴或享受的液体，包括水、果汁、酒精饮料或其他饮品。
definitions.example_en: She ordered a hot drink to warm up after the cold walk.
definitions.example_cn: 在寒冷的散步后，她点了一杯热饮来暖身。

definitions.explanation_en: A specific serving or portion of a beverage, often consumed in one go.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一次饮用的特定份量，通常一次性喝完。
definitions.example_en: He took a quick drink from his water bottle before the race.
definitions.example_cn: 比赛前，他从水瓶里快速喝了一口水。

definitions.explanation_en: To consume a liquid by swallowing it, typically to satisfy thirst or for enjoyment.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过吞咽来摄入液体，通常为解渴或享受。
definitions.example_en: They drank tea together every morning at sunrise.
definitions.example_cn: 他们每天日出时一起喝茶。

definitions.explanation_en: To consume alcohol excessively or habitually, often implying intoxication.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指过量或习惯性地饮酒，常暗示醉酒状态。
definitions.example_en: He drinks too much on weekends and regrets it on Monday.
definitions.example_cn: 他周末喝得太多，周一又后悔。

comparison.analysis: “Beverage” (饮料) 是一个更正式、更广泛的术语，泛指所有可饮用的液体，常用于商业、菜单或科学语境。而 “drink” 更口语化，既可指液体本身，也可指饮用的动作，语义范围更广，使用更灵活。
“Sip” (小口喝) 强调缓慢、少量地饮用，通常带有优雅或谨慎的意味，如品茶或品酒。而 “drink” 是中性动词，泛指任何饮用行为，不强调方式或速度。
“Consume” (消费/摄入) 是一个更广义的词，可指摄入食物、饮料、资源甚至信息，语义更抽象和正式。而 “drink” 专指液体摄入，语义更具体、更日常。
